item.ptxt: After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (See page ) and initialization (See page ).
After replacing a fuel supply pump, the ECM needs initialization (See page ).
After replacing an injector, the ECM needs registration (See page ).

atten4.ptxt: Specified values in the following troubleshooting flowchart are for reference only. Variations in the Data List values may occur depending on the measuring conditions or the vehicle's age. Do not assume the vehicle to be normal when the Data List outputs standard values. There may be concealed factors of the malfunction.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the GTS ON.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

test1.ptxt: Read DTCs.

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM ACCORDING TO DTC OUTPUT

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INJECTION VOLUME AND INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL #1 TO #8)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS ON.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus in order and read the values.

atten4.ptxt: *: If no idling conditions are specified, the shift lever should be in the neutral position, and the A/C switch and all accessory switches should be OFF.

action.actiontitle: GO TO STEP 11

atten4.ptxt: If the exhaust gas contains excessive black smoke, perform the following operations.

test1.ptxt: Accelerate the engine speed to the maximum rpm with no load 20 times.
Check the volume of black smoke in the exhaust gas.

entry.ptxt: Black smoke remains in the exhaust gas

atten4.ptxt: Soot deposits in the exhaust system may cause excessive black smoke.

action.actiontitle: END

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK AIR INTAKE SYSTEM AND EXHAUST SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Check air intake system and exhaust system.
Click here

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE LOCATIONS WHERE MALFUNCTIONS EXIST

test1.ptxt: Inspect the mass air flow meter.
Click here

action.actiontitle: REPLACE MASS AIR FLOW METER

test1.ptxt: Check the turbocharger pressure.
Click here

specitem.ptxt: The turbocharger pressure is within the standard range.

action.actiontitle: REPLACE TURBOCHARGER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS ON.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus in order and read the values.

atten4.ptxt: *: If no idling conditions are specified, the shift lever should be in the neutral position, and the A/C switch and all accessory switches should be OFF.

entry.ptxt: One of Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 is not within reference value

action.actiontitle: GO TO DTC P1238 INSPECTION PROCEDURE

test1.ptxt: Check the cylinder compression pressure.
Click here

action.actiontitle: CHECK ENGINE TO DETERMINE CAUSE OF LOW COMPRESSION

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the C48, C72, C64 and C57 fuel injector connectors.

entry.ptxt: Front view of wire harness connector
Front view of wire harness connector

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the C55 No. 1 EDU connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.
Disconnect the C67, C51, C49 and C63 fuel injector connectors.

entry.ptxt: Front view of wire harness connector
Front view of wire harness connector

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the C53 No. 2 EDU connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM GTS (CONTROL THE SELECT CYLINDER FUEL CUT)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut

app-param-unit.app-param: Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut

test1.ptxt: Check the engine idle speed while the fuel injection to each cylinder is cut using the GTS.

atten4.ptxt: Replace the injector mounted on the cylinder that causes no significant idle speed change.

action.actiontitle: REPLACE INJECTOR DRIVER
GO TO DTC P1238 INSPECTION PROCEDURE

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (ENGINE COOLANT TEMPERATURE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the GTS ON.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Coolant Temp.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the value.

entry.ptxt: Idling with warm engine (A/C switch OFF)

Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the GTS ON.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAP.

test1.ptxt: Read the value.

specitem.ptxt: Same value as the actual atmospheric pressure.

Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the GTS ON.
Start the engine and warm it up.

test1.ptxt: Read the value.

entry.ptxt: Idling with warm engine (A/C switch OFF)

test1.ptxt: Replace the ECM.
Click here

atten3.ptxt: After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (See page ) and initialization (See page ).

test1.ptxt: Check if the engine starts smoothly or if the engine stalls.

specitem.ptxt: The engine starts smoothly and does not stall.

action.actiontitle: END
REPLACE FUEL SUPPLY PUMP

test1.ptxt: Remove the engine coolant temperature sensor.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

atten3.ptxt: When checking the sensor in water, keep the terminals dry. After the check, wipe the sensor dry.

atten4.ptxt: Alternative procedure: Connect an ohmmeter to the installed ECT sensor and read the resistance. Use an infrared thermometer to measure the engine temperature in the immediate vicinity of the sensor. Compare these values against the resistance/temperature graph. Change the engine temperature (warm up or cool down) and repeat the test.

test1.ptxt: Reconnect the engine coolant temperature sensor.

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR
REPLACE ENGINE COOLANT TEMPERATURE SENSOR

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the C42 crankshaft position sensor connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

atten4.ptxt: In the table above, the terms "Cold" and "Hot" refer to the temperature of the coils in the sensor. "Cold" means approximately -10 to 50°C (14 to 122°F). "Hot" mean sapproximately 50 to 100°C (122 to 212°F).

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR
REPLACE CRANKSHAFT POSITION SENSOR
